dcterms:creator: S. Thrun
W. Burgard
D. Fox
dcterms:description: The 3Doors environment is a classic problem in SLAM where a robot navigates along a one-dimensional line and observes distances to three doors, which serve as landmarks. The challenge lies in uncertain data association as the robot must determine which door corresponds to its measurements.
dcterms:title: 3Doors environment

dcterms:creator: J. D. Martin
B. Englot
dcterms:description: The Nonlinear Planar Navigation dataset involves a robot localizing its three-dimensional state using measurements corrupted by additive Gaussian noise. The robot's state evolves according to a nonlinear transition model, simulating marine vehicles.
dcterms:title: Nonlinear Planar Navigation

dcterms:creator: D. Kingma
J. Ba
dcterms:description: Various datasets were used in experiments to validate the proposed methods, although they are not explicitly named in the paper. These datasets support the evaluation of the VC-SMC algorithm in different SLAM scenarios.
dcterms:title: Various datasets used in experiments

dcterms:creator: S. Thrun
W. Burgard
D. Fox
dcterms:description: The Gaussian mixture model for landmark observations is used to represent the uncertainty in landmark measurements in the SLAM context. This model allows for the incorporation of multiple hypotheses about landmark positions.
dcterms:title: Gaussian mixture model for landmark observations

dcterms:creator: G. Grisetti
C. Stachniss
W. Burgard
dcterms:description: The Non-Gaussian SLAM settings dataset provides a framework for testing SLAM algorithms that operate under non-Gaussian assumptions, allowing for the evaluation of robustness and accuracy in complex environments.
dcterms:title: Non-Gaussian SLAM settings
